info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:29PM EDT until July 27 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY... At 328 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Greenfield, or 13 miles northeast of Jaffrey, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bedford, Amherst, Peterborough, New Boston, Mont Vernon, Greenfield, Lyndeborough, Francestown, Bennington, Mount Vernon, Hancock, Weare, Goffstown, Deering and Temple. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
